**FOR ALL 3 PROBLEMS**: Let $X$ and $Y$ be two continuous random variables with join pdf $$f(x,y) = 3xy, \ 0 < x<y, \ x + y \leq 2$$

**Problem 1 (3pts)** Find P(X + Y \< 1)

### SOLUTION

![](images/bounds.png){width="202" height="140"}

$$
\begin{aligned}
P(X+Y<1)
&=\int_{0}^{1/2}\int_{x}^{\,1-x} 3xy \, dy \, dx \\[4pt]
&=\int_{0}^{1/2} 3x \left[ \frac{y^{2}}{2} \right]_{y=x}^{1-x} dx \\[4pt]
&=\int_{0}^{1/2} \frac{3x}{2} \big( (1-x)^2 - x^2 \big)\, dx \\[4pt]
&=\int_{0}^{1/2} \frac{3x}{2} (1 - 2x)\, dx \\[4pt]
&=\int_{0}^{1/2} \left( \frac{3}{2}x - 3x^2 \right) dx \\[4pt]
&=\left[ \frac{3}{4}x^2 - x^3 \right]_{0}^{1/2} \\[4pt]
&=\frac{3}{16} - \frac{1}{8} \\[4pt]
&=\frac{1}{16}.
\end{aligned}
$$

**Problem 2 (1pt)**: Find an expression for the marginal distribution of $X$. You can leave your answer written as an integral, but make clear what function you are integrating and what the appropriate bounds are.

$$
f_X(x) = \int_{x}^{2-x} 3xy\,dy
$$

**Problem 3 (1pt)**: Find an expression for $f(y | x = \frac{1}{2})$

$$
f(y \mid x=\tfrac12)
    =
    \frac{f\!\left(0.5,\, y\right)}
         {\int_{0.5}^{1.5} 3(0.5)y\,dy} = \frac{3(0.5)y}
         {\int_{0.5}^{1.5} 3(0.5)y\,dy} = y, \ \ 0.5 < y < 1.5
$$

$$
f_X\!\left(\tfrac12\right)
    =
    \int_{y_{\min}}^{y_{\max}}
        f_{X,Y}\!\left(\tfrac12,\, t\right)\,dt
$$

$$
f(y \mid x=\tfrac12)
    =
    \frac{f_{X,Y}\!\left(\tfrac12,\, y\right)}
         {\displaystyle \int_{y_{\min}}^{y_{\max}}
             f_{X,Y}\!\left(\tfrac12,\, t\right)\,dt }
$$
